snippet: The preserved heart of St. Laurence O’Toole has disappeared in the latest in a string of thefts from churches across Ireland.
abstract: Latest in a series of thefts of irreplaceable religious relics from churches across Ireland is the removal of the preserved heart of St Laurence O’Toole, Dublin’s 12th-century patron saint, from the city’s historic Christ Church Cathedral; although the sale of relics is forbidden by Christian churches, a trade in them appears to be flourishing on eBay and in many antique stores and flea markets.
lead_paragraph: The preserved heart of St. Laurence O’Toole has disappeared in the latest in a string of thefts from churches across Ireland.

headline.seo: Saint’s Preserved Heart Stolen From Dublin Church
headline.main: Relic of a Saint Is Stolen From a Dublin Cathedral
headline.print_headline: Relic of a Saint Is Stolen From a Dublin Cathedral
